<!-- #region button=false new_sheet=false run_control={"read_only": false} -->
### About dataset

<!-- #endregion -->

<!-- #region button=false new_sheet=false run_control={"read_only": false} -->
This dataset is about past loans. The **Loan_train.csv** data set includes details of 346 customers whose loan are already paid off or defaulted. It includes following fields:

| Field          | Description                                                                           |
| -------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Loan_status    | Whether a loan is paid off on in collection                                           |
| Principal      | Basic principal loan amount at the                                                    |
| Terms          | Origination terms which can be weekly (7 days), biweekly, and monthly payoff schedule |
| Effective_date | When the loan got originated and took effects                                         |
| Due_date       | Since it’s one-time payoff schedule, each loan has one single due date                |
| Age            | Age of applicant                                                                      |
| Education      | Education of applicant                                                                |
| Gender         | The gender of applicant                                                               |

<!-- #endregion -->

<!-- #region button=false new_sheet=false run_control={"read_only": false} -->
Let's download the dataset

<!-- #endregion -->

```{python button=FALSE, new_sheet=FALSE, run_control={'read_only': False}}
# #!wget -O loan_train.csv https://cf-courses-data.s3.us.cloud-object-storage.appdomain.cloud/IBMDeveloperSkillsNetwork-ML0101EN-SkillsNetwork/labs/FinalModule_Coursera/data/loan_train.csv
```

<!-- #region button=false new_sheet=false run_control={"read_only": false} -->
### Load Data From CSV File

<!-- #endregion -->

```{python button=FALSE, new_sheet=FALSE, run_control={'read_only': False}}
df = pd.read_csv('loan_train.csv')
df.head()
```

```{python}
df.shape
```

<!-- #region button=false new_sheet=false run_control={"read_only": false} -->
### Convert to date time object

<!-- #endregion -->

```{python button=FALSE, new_sheet=FALSE, run_control={'read_only': False}}
df['due_date'] = pd.to_datetime(df['due_date'])
df['effective_date'] = pd.to_datetime(df['effective_date'])
df.head()
```

<!-- #region button=false new_sheet=false run_control={"read_only": false} -->
# Pre-processing:  Feature selection/extraction

<!-- #endregion -->

<!-- #region button=false new_sheet=false run_control={"read_only": false} -->
### Let's look at the day of the week people get the loan

<!-- #endregion -->

```{python button=FALSE, new_sheet=FALSE, run_control={'read_only': False}}
df['dayofweek'] = df['effective_date'].dt.dayofweek
bins = np.linspace(df.dayofweek.min(), df.dayofweek.max(), 10)
g = sns.FacetGrid(df, col="Gender", 
                  hue="loan_status", 
                  palette="Set1", 
                  col_wrap=2)
g.map(plt.hist, 'dayofweek', bins=bins, ec="k")
g.axes[-1].legend()
plt.show()

```

<!-- #region button=false new_sheet=false run_control={"read_only": false} -->
We see that people who get the loan at the end of the week don't pay it off, so let's use Feature binarization to set a threshold value less than day 4

<!-- #endregion -->

```{python button=FALSE, new_sheet=FALSE, run_control={'read_only': False}}
df['weekend'] = df['dayofweek'].apply(lambda x: 1 if (x>3)  else 0)
df.head()
```

<!-- #region button=false new_sheet=false run_control={"read_only": false} -->
## Convert Categorical features to numerical values

<!-- #endregion -->

<!-- #region button=false new_sheet=false run_control={"read_only": false} -->
Let's look at gender:

<!-- #endregion -->

```{python button=FALSE, new_sheet=FALSE, run_control={'read_only': False}}
df.groupby(['Gender'])['loan_status'].value_counts(normalize=True)
```

<!-- #region button=false new_sheet=false run_control={"read_only": false} -->
86 % of female pay there loans while only 73 % of males pay there loan

<!-- #endregion -->

<!-- #region button=false new_sheet=false run_control={"read_only": false} -->
Let's convert male to 0 and female to 1:

<!-- #endregion -->

```{python button=FALSE, new_sheet=FALSE, run_control={'read_only': False}}
df['Gender'].replace(to_replace=['male','female'],
                     value=[0,1],inplace=True)
df.head()
```

<!-- #region button=false new_sheet=false run_control={"read_only": false} -->
## One Hot Encoding

#### How about education?

<!-- #endregion -->

```{python button=FALSE, new_sheet=FALSE, run_control={'read_only': False}}
df.groupby(['education'])['loan_status'].value_counts(normalize=True)
```

<!-- #region button=false new_sheet=false run_control={"read_only": false} -->
#### Features before One Hot Encoding

<!-- #endregion -->

```{python button=FALSE, new_sheet=FALSE, run_control={'read_only': False}}
df[['Principal','terms','age','Gender','education']].head()
```

<!-- #region button=false new_sheet=false run_control={"read_only": false} -->
#### Use one hot encoding technique to conver categorical varables to binary variables and append them to the feature Data Frame

<!-- #endregion -->

```{python}
df[df['education']=='Master or Above'].index
pd.get_dummies(df['education'])
```

```{python button=FALSE, new_sheet=FALSE, run_control={'read_only': False}}
Feature = df[['Principal','terms','age','Gender','weekend']]
Feature = pd.concat([Feature, pd.get_dummies(df['education'])], axis=1)
Feature.drop(['Master or Above'], axis = 1, inplace=True)
Feature.head()
Feature
```

<!-- #region button=false new_sheet=false run_control={"read_only": false} -->
### Feature Selection

<!-- #endregion -->

<!-- #region button=false new_sheet=false run_control={"read_only": false} -->
Let's define feature sets, X:

<!-- #endregion -->

```{python button=FALSE, new_sheet=FALSE, run_control={'read_only': False}}

X[0:5]
```

## Normalize Data

<!-- #endregion -->

<!-- #region button=false new_sheet=false run_control={"read_only": false} -->
